Letter from Volcano Manor.name: Letter from Volcano Manor
Letter from Volcano Manor.summary:
Request from Volcano Manor
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A written request from Volcano Manor disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted.
"Rileigh the Idle"
He can be found in Altus Plateau. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

Red Letter.name: Red Letter
Red Letter.summary:
Request from Volcano Manor
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A written request from Volcano Manor disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted. As the final request, the letter is vivid red.
"Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood"
He can be found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

Volcano Manor Invitation.name: Volcano Manor Invitation
Volcano Manor Invitation.summary: Letter of invitation to Volcano Manor
description: Letter given by Rya as thanks for retrieving her necklace.
Contains an invitation to Volcano Manor.
"Brave Tarnished,
Seek the Altus Plateau in the realm of the Erdtree.
Prove yourself by making this journey, and the Volcano Manor will fully extend its invitation. To fight, amongst a family of champions."

Letter to Patches.name: Letter to Patches
Letter to Patches.summary:
Request from Volcano Manor to Patches
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Patches disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted.
"Great Horned Tragoth"
He can be found at the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

Letter to Bernahl.name: Letter to Bernahl
Letter to Bernahl.summary:
Request from Volcano Manor to Bernahl
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Bernahl disclosing the names of two Tarnished to be hunted.
"Vargram the Raging Wolf"
"Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm"
Both men can be found in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

Knifeprint Clue.name: Knifeprint Clue
Knifeprint Clue.summary:
Simple map showing location of black knifeprint
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A simple map given by Fia.
A clue to the whereabouts of a black knifeprint.

Meeting Place Map.name: Meeting Place Map
Meeting Place Map.summary:
Simple map showing a meeting place
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Simple map found on a corpse.
Seems to point to a meeting place.
The man it came from surely desired one. The sole means of gaining entry into the academy: a glintstone key.

\"Homing Instinct\" Painting.name: "Homing Instinct" Painting
\"Homing Instinct\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Homing Instinct"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Homing Instinct."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Resurrection\" Painting.name: "Resurrection" Painting
\"Resurrection\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Resurrection"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Resurrection."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Champion's Song\" Painting.name: "Champion's Song" Painting
\"Champion's Song\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Champion's Song"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Champion's Song."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Sorcerer\" Painting.name: "Sorcerer" Painting
\"Sorcerer\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Sorcerer"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Sorcerer."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Prophecy\" Painting.name: "Prophecy" Painting
\"Prophecy\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Prophecy"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Prophecy."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Flightless Bird\" Painting.name: "Flightless Bird" Painting
\"Flightless Bird\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Flightless Bird"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Flightless Bird."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

\"Redmane\" Painting.name: "Redmane" Painting
\"Redmane\" Painting.summary:
Reminiscence of the painting "Redmane"
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Work of a wandering artist.
Reminiscence of a painting titled "Redmane."
This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace.
The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

Zorayas's Letter.name: Zorayas's Letter
Zorayas's Letter.summary:
Farewell letter written in an inexpert hand
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Farewell letter written in an inexpert hand.
"I wish to set out on a journey.
So that one day, I can carry on Mother's work.
Be the proud daughter of Tanith of Volcano Manor.
Farewell.
You've always been so kind. So uncompromising.
My champion."

Rogier's Letter.name: Rogier's Letter
Rogier's Letter.summary:
Letter written in a trembling hand
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Letter written in a trembling hand.
"I forgot to tell you, but it seems D has a younger brother.
I heard he lies in a deep sleep in the aqueduct beside the Eternal City of Nokron.
And it's said he stood before the Prince of Death not far beyond that spot."

Note: The Preceptor's Secret.name: Note: The Preceptor's Secret
Note: The Preceptor's Secret.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Preceptor Seluvis is hiding a dirty secret in a cellar among the ruins not far from the sisters three.
The vile Graven Witch seems to be a frequent visitor to that place."

Weathered Map.name: Weathered Map
Weathered Map.summary:
A simple map, badly weathered
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: A simple, badly weathered map.
Left discarded and forgotten for some time.
Depicts streaks of amber light.

Mirage Riddle.name: Mirage Riddle
Mirage Riddle.summary:
Simple map taken from an imp statue
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Simple map taken from an imp statue.
A riddle concerning a rise that vanishes like a mirage.

Note: Hidden Cave.name: Note: Hidden Cave
Note: Hidden Cave.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"There is a hidden cave in the town of Sellia.
Look beyond the graveyard at the precipice."

Note: Imp Shades.name: Note: Imp Shades
Note: Imp Shades.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Nothing can touch the shades of imps in the heroes' graveyard.
Only Rosus's light can give them form."

Note: Flask of Wondrous Physick.name: Note: Flask of Wondrous Physick
Note: Flask of Wondrous Physick.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"A Flask of Wondrous Physick still remains in the Third Church of Marika, north of the Mistwood.
Cross the highway bridge and follow the animal trail north."

Note: Stonedigger Trolls.name: Note: Stonedigger Trolls
Note: Stonedigger Trolls.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"The heads of the stonedigger trolls bear old wounds."

Note: Wandering Mausoleum.name: Note: Wandering Mausoleum
Note: Wandering Mausoleum.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"To stop the mausoleum's stride, you'll need to clean up around its feet first."

Note: Unseen Assassins.name: Note: Unseen Assassins
Note: Unseen Assassins.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Some assassins cannot be seen with the naked eye.
Seems the Erdtree sentries once carried torches that could cast light on these prowlers."

Note: Great Coffins.name: Note: Great Coffins
Note: Great Coffins.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Great coffins travel the Lands Between, carrying the bodies of nameless fallen warriors.
Might be a good source of armaments..."

Note: Flame Chariots.name: Note: Flame Chariots
Note: Flame Chariots.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Beware the Fire Monks' chariots bearing the faces of giants.
A well-aimed blow to the chimney on top may prove effective, but opportunities for a plunging attack will be rare indeed."

Note: Demi-human Mobs.name: Note: Demi-human Mobs
Note: Demi-human Mobs.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Slay the demi-human mob's leader first, and the rest will lose hope and panic."

Note: Land Squirts.name: Note: Land Squirts
Note: Land Squirts.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Land squirts are soft where they touch the ground, and poison will cause them to rupture."

Note: Gravity's Advantage.name: Note: Gravity's Advantage
Note: Gravity's Advantage.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Gravitational power that pulls can bring flying foes low."

Note: Revenants.name: Note: Revenants
Note: Revenants.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"The crawling royal revenants and their followers are all cursed.
Healing powers will harm rather than mend."

Note: Waypoint Ruins.name: Note: Waypoint Ruins
Note: Waypoint Ruins.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Someone lurks among the waypoint ruins on the roads through Limgrave."

Note: Gateway.name: Note: Gateway
Note: Gateway.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Fort Gael in Caelid houses a gateway that leads to Redmane Castle."

Note: Miquella's Needle.name: Note: Miquella's Needle
Note: Miquella's Needle.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note written by a nomadic merchant succinctly detailing knowledge acquired.
"The Empyrean Miquella crafted a needle to resist the influence of outer gods.
Those who have inherited the flame of frenzy, yet wish not to become its lord would do well to seek Miquella's needle."

Note: Frenzied Flame Village.name: Note: Frenzied Flame Village
Note: Frenzied Flame Village.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"South of the Grand Lift of Dectus lies the Frenzied Flame Village, inhabited by the sick. Stay well away."

Note: The Lord of Frenzied Flame.name: Note: The Lord of Frenzied Flame
Note: The Lord of Frenzied Flame.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Beneath Leyndell, at the very bottom lies our lord, lord of the frenzied. The Three Fingers who holds us in thrall."

Note: Below the Capital.name: Note: Below the Capital
Note: Below the Capital.summary:
Note imparting knowledge in brief
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note sold by a nomadic merchant imparting knowledge in brief.
"Below the royal capital of Leyndell is a vast network of sewers.
The well in the city below reaches deep into its tunnels."

Sellia's Secret.name: Sellia's Secret
Sellia's Secret.summary:
A piece of paper given by Sage Gowry
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Note given by Sage Gowry detailing the secret he promised.
The Town of Sellia
hides the source.
Light three flames
atop the candle towers
to break the seal.

About Sites of Grace.name: About Sites of Grace
About Sites of Grace.summary:
Information about sites of grace
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Resting at a site of grace will restore your HP, FP, and cleanse any status ailments.
It will also refill your sacred flasks.
However, most of the enemies you've defeated will be revived.
You can find sites of grace by going where light converges.

About Sorceries and Incantations.name: About Sorceries and Incantations
About Sorceries and Incantations.summary:
Information about sorceries and incantations
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: You can memorize sorceries and incantations at sites of grace.
You must have a staff equipped to cast sorceries, or a sacred seal equipped to cast incantations.
Casting sorceries and incantations consumes FP.
<?keyicon@0017?>: <?keyActName@17?>

About Bows.name: About Bows
description: Equip a bow to fire arrows.
You can equip up to two types of arrows to choose from at once.
When wielding a bow with two hands, hold <?keyicon@24?> for precision aiming.
Use <?keyControlCamera?> to adjust your aim.
<?keyicon@22?>: Fire arrow type 1
<?keyicon@23?>: Fire arrow type 2
<?keyicon@24?>: Precision aiming

About Crouching.name: About Crouching
description: Crouch to make it harder for enemies to discover you.
Especially effective in tall grass.
Attacking an enemy that hasn't noticed you will cause more damage than usual.
<?keyicon@9?>: <?keyActName@9?>

About Stance-Breaking.name: About Stance-Breaking
description: Some attacks may break an enemy's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.
Charge attacks and jump attacks make it particularly easy to break an enemy's stance.
Hold <?keyicon@23?>: Charge attack
<?keyicon@23?> while jumping: Jump attack

About Stakes of Marika.name: About Stakes of Marika
About Stakes of Marika.summary:
Information about Stakes of Marika
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.
However, if there is a Stake of Marika near where you died, you can choose to be revived there instead.

About Guard Counters.name: About Guard Counters
About Guard Counters.summary:
Information about guard counters
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: You can perform a counterattack immediately after blocking an enemy attack.
Guard counters make it easy to break an enemy's stance.
<?keyicon@23?> immediately after blocking an attack: Guard Counter

About the Map.name: About the Map
About the Map.summary:
Information about the map
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use your map to check your current position, as well as the terrain and surrounding structures.
You can update your map with new information by finding Map fragments at steles along the road.
You can also use the map to freely place beacons of light to serve as landmarks as you explore.
<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>

About Guidance of Grace.name: About Guidance of Grace
About Guidance of Grace.summary:
Information about Guidance of Grace
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Grace exists to guide the Tarnished and lead them along the proper path.
Even now, some sites of grace retain that power. Their golden rays will guide you along your way.

About Horseback Riding.name: About Horseback Riding
About Horseback Riding.summary:
Information about horseback riding
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use the Spectral Steed Whistle to summon and ride your spectral steed.
If your spectral steed dies, you can summon it again, but it will cost one Flask of Crimson Tears to do so.
You can dismount by using the whistle again or by pressing <?keyicon@0009?>.

About Death.name: About Death
description: Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.
You will drop any runes in your possession at the site of your death.
If you die again before reclaiming those runes, they will be lost forever.
The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the lost runes.

About Summoning Spirits.name: About Summoning Spirits
About Summoning Spirits.summary:
Information about summoning spirits
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: With a Spirit Calling Bell, you can use ashes to summon various spirits.
Summoning typically consumes FP.
You can only summon one type of spirit at a time.
You cannot summon spirits during multiplayer.

About Guarding.name: About Guarding
description: Use an armament in your left hand or both hands to guard against incoming attacks.
Guarding is especially effective when done with a shield.
Guarding consumes stamina.
If your stamina runs out, your stance will be broken.
<?keyicon@24?>: Guard

About Item Crafting.name: About Item Crafting
About Item Crafting.summary:
Information about item crafting
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: If you have a Crafting Kit, you can make various items from materials that you find.
Select "Item Crafting" from the main menu to make items.
You can learn to craft more items by finding cookbooks.
<?keyicon@28?>: <?keyActName@28?>

About Flask of Wondrous Physick.name: About Flask of Wondrous Physick
About Flask of Wondrous Physick.summary:
Information about Flask of Wondrous Physick
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: You can find crystal tears at the bases of Minor Erdtrees and elsewhere throughout the Lands Between.
At sites of grace, you can mix two crystal tears in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
This will allow you to create elixirs with various custom effects.

About Adding Skills.name: About Adding Skills
About Adding Skills.summary:
Information about adding skills
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: With a Whetstone Knife, you can use ashes of war to grant your armaments new skills at sites of grace.
An armament can only have one skill.
Any skill it previously had will be removed.
An armament's type determines what skills it can have. Some special armaments have unique skills and cannot be granted new ones.

About Birdseye Telescopes.name: About Birdseye Telescopes
About Birdseye Telescopes.summary:
Information about birdseye telescopes
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use the Birdseye Telescopes in each area to see into the distance like a bird and get a better view of your destination.
<?keyicon@17?>: Zoom in
<?keyicon@18?>: Zoom out

About Spiritspring Jumping.name: About Spiritspring Jumping
About Spiritspring Jumping.summary:
Information about spiritspring jumping
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Jump while on horseback near a spiritspring to ride its current high into the air.
You won't take damage from jumping into a spiritspring while on horseback, even from a great height.
<?keyicon@8?> at a spiritspring while on horseback: Spiritspring jump

About Vanquishing Enemy Groups.name: About Vanquishing Enemy Groups
About Vanquishing Enemy Groups.summary:
Information about vanquishing enemy groups
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Vanquishing an enemy group will replenish your flasks.
The number and type of flasks to be replenished varies, depending on the enemy group.
You cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.

About Teardrop Scarabs.name: About Teardrop Scarabs
About Teardrop Scarabs.summary:
Information about Teardrop Scarabs
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs.
Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.
However, you cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.

About Summoning Other Players.name: About Summoning Other Players
About Summoning Other Players.summary:
Information about summoning other players
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use Furlcalling Finger Remedy to reveal summon signs of players from other worlds.
Gold signs indicate an ally.
Red signs indicate an adversary.
The multiplayer session will begin once either type has been summoned.
(You will take the role of the Host of Fingers.)

About Cooperative Multiplayer.name: About Cooperative Multiplayer
About Cooperative Multiplayer.summary:
Information about cooperative multiplayer
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use Tarnished's Furled Finger to write a gold summon sign.
Cooperative multiplayer will begin once you have been summoned by a player from another world.
You will take the role of an ally (Furled Finger) and your objective is to defeat the area boss.
The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the summoner (Host of Fingers).

About Competitive Multiplayer.name: About Competitive Multiplayer
About Competitive Multiplayer.summary:
Information about competitive multiplayer
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use Duelist's Furled Finger to write a red summon sign.
Competitive multiplayer will begin once you have been summoned by a player from another world.
You will take the role of an adversary (Duelist) and your objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers who summoned you.

About Invasion Multiplayer.name: About Invasion Multiplayer
About Invasion Multiplayer.summary:
Information about invasion multiplayer
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Use Festering Bloody Finger to attempt to invade the world of another player.
The multiplayer session will begin once the invasion succeeds.
You will take the role of an invader (Bloody Finger) and your objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers of that world.
If you stray far from the Host of Fingers, the compass at the top of the screen points to their location.

About Hunter Multiplayer.name: About Hunter Multiplayer
About Hunter Multiplayer.summary:
Information about hunter multiplayer
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: If you use a Blue Cipher Ring, you will make yourself open to summons for rescue from other worlds.
The multiplayer session will begin once you have been summoned as a hunter, and your objective is to defeat the invader of that world.
The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the summoner (Host of Fingers).

About Summoning Pools.name: About Summoning Pools
About Summoning Pools.summary:
Information about the summoning pools
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: In each area, you may find effigies of martyrs.
These effigies are summoning pools.
You'll find it easy to summon other players at these locations, as co-op and hostile summoning signs created with small effigies gather at summoning pools.

About Monument Icon.name: About Monument Icon
About Monument Icon.summary:
Information about Monument Icon
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: You must be near a rebirth monument to summon spirits from ashes.
When you are close to a rebirth monument and able to summon, a monument icon will appear on the left side of the screen.

About Requesting Help from Hunters.name: About Requesting Help from Hunters
About Requesting Help from Hunters.summary:
Information about requesting help from hunters
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: If you use a White Cipher Ring, you will automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.
(Can also be used after you are invaded.)
The hunter will be summoned once the request succeeds, and their objective is to defeat the invader of your world.

About Skills.name: About Skills
description: Armaments have special abilities called skills.
Skills are highly varied, and range from powerful attacks to temporary effects.
Using skills consumes FP.
<?keyicon@25?>: <?keyActName@25?>

About Fast Travel to Sites of Grace.name: About Fast Travel to Sites of Grace
About Fast Travel to Sites of Grace.summary:
Information about fast travel to sites of grace
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Through your map, you can instantly travel to any sites of grace that you've discovered.
However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.

About Strengthening Armaments.name: About Strengthening Armaments
About Strengthening Armaments.summary:
Information about strengthening armaments
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: At a smithing table, you can spend runes and smithing stones to strengthen your armaments.
Somewhere in the Lands Between, you may meet a blacksmith who can make your armaments even stronger.

About Roundtable Hold.name: About Roundtable Hold
About Roundtable Hold.summary:
Information about the Roundtable Hold
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: The Roundtable Hold is a place where Tarnished gather, guided by grace. Combat is prohibited on the premises due to a pact of non-aggression.
(This rule is in effect when the Roundtable icon is displayed.)
The Roundtable Hold is located outside of this world, and fast travel by grace is the only means of reaching it. (Use the map to travel there.)
<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>

About Materials.name: About Materials
description: In every corner of the Lands Between, you will find fruits and flowers, mushrooms and butterflies, and various other useful materials.
These materials can be used for item crafting.

About Containers.name: About Containers
description: You will need cracked pots or other containers to craft certain items.
You will not be able to make more of those items than you have containers.
Containers will be consumed when crafting, but they can be reused when emptied.

About Adding Affinities.name: About Adding Affinities
About Adding Affinities.summary:
Information about adding affinities to armaments
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: With a Whetstone Knife, you can use ashes of war to grant affinities to your armaments at sites of grace.
This way, you can alter an armament's attack affinity, boost attribute scaling, and more.
An armament's type determines what affinities it can have. Some special armaments, like those with unique skills, cannot be granted new affinities.

About Pouches.name: About Pouches
description: From "Pouch" in the main menu, you can equip six items to your pouches.
Four of those items can be used without opening the main menu.
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@17?>: Use item in Pouch 1
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@19?>: Use item in Pouch 2
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@20?>: Use item in Pouch 3
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@18?>: Use item in Pouch 4

About Dodging.name: About Dodging
description: You can avoid enemy attacks with a dodge roll or backstep.
Both of these actions consume stamina.
<?keyMove?>+<?keyicon@7?>: Dodge roll
<?keyicon@7?>: Backstep

About Wielding Armaments.name: About Wielding Armaments
About Wielding Armaments.summary:
Information about wielding armaments
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Each hand can be equipped with up to three armaments, allowing you to toggle between them.
Armaments can also be two-handed, making attacks more difficult to repel with shields and boosting effective strength by 50%.
<?keyicon@19?>: <?keyActName@19?>
<?keyicon@20?>: <?keyActName@20?>
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@24?>/<?keyicon@22?>: Wield with two hands

About Great Runes.name: About Great Runes
About Great Runes.summary:
Information about Great Runes
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: The Great Runes you receive by defeating shardbearers have lost their beneficial power.
However, their power can be restored at Divine Towers throughout the Lands Between.
See the description of each Great Rune to discover which Divine Tower you should visit.

About the Cave of Knowledge.name: About the Cave of Knowledge
About the Cave of Knowledge.summary:
Information about the Cave of Knowledge
Examine using <?keyicon@31?>
description: Jump down the hole ahead, and you will find the Cave of Knowledge.
There, you can learn more about game controls and basic actions, as well as other tips that may be helpful during your adventures in the Lands Between.
